text: Think of all the people out there today who are paying their taxes: Families, small businesses, students. They can't take advantage of the loopholes in our tax code the way that giant corporations like Amazon can. That’s where my Real Corporate Profits Tax comes in. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1117081713564368897/img/q91ko5ERSHc1axQ_.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1117081713564368897/vid/320x180/CIa5CaHOJ6xl3tGe.mp4?tag=11

RT @ezralevin .@Ilhan's life is being threatened by Fox News, GOP members of congress, and the President of the United States. I want to see Democratic leadership standing 100% behind Omar and against these attacks. (I'd like to see GOP members too, but I'm not holding my breath).
RT @kat_rogers Dartmouth is fired up to hang out with @ewarren this afternoon! #nhpolitics #Warren2020 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D4C-UtOW0AEBmiY.jpg

RT @RepJoeKennedy President Trump understands the weight his words carry. His tweet about Congresswoman Ilhan Omar puts her life & her family’s lives at risk. Our outrage should be nonpartisan. That it’s not will only give him license to continue to incite violence.

As we visit our troops in Stuttgart to thank them and be briefed by them, we honor our first responsibility as leaders to protect and defend the American people.  It is wrong for the President, as Commander-in-Chief, to fan the flames to make anyone less safe.
RT @JulianCastro I am grateful for @IlhanMN's courage and leadership and I stand with her - and with others targeted by the President's anti-Muslim rhetoric.

#MedicareForAll is not just a piece of health care legislation. It is a struggle for the soul of who we are as a nation. We will be opposed by some of the most powerful forces in our country — together, we are going to defeat them and guarantee health care as a human right.

🎶 Ain't gonna let injustice turn me around
I'm gonna keep on walkin' /
Gonna keep on talkin' /
Marchin' up to freedom's land

We ain’t gonna let nobody turn us around/ 🎶

The memory of 9/11 is sacred ground, and any discussion of it must be done with reverence.  The President shouldn’t use the painful images of 9/11 for a political attack.

Just wrapped up our house party in Lebanon, New Hampshire! This weekend, people all around the country are participating in #WinWithWarren organizing house parties to talk about how we can build a real grassroots movement together. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D4DYBiAXkAAmI9t.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1117129744439488512/vid/320x568/udCkpxv3BN1xhOxO.mp4?tag=11

RT @174Steamfitter Beyond excited to have @BernieSanders at our @UAPipeTrades Union Hall today.  Senator Sanders spoke about issues affecting West Michigan's working families.  Getting him setup with some #174 swag. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D4D5lhRWsAE1aQe.jpg

I ended my day in a perfect way: At a #WinWithWarren organizing house party in Londonderry. It was packed with grassroots supporters who are ready to roll up their sleeves and start fighting for big, structural change in our country. That’s what this campaign is all about. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D4FUCfUW4AA-buF.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1117265933502943233/vid/320x180/cdUMxkFjTYhg5yKw.mp4?tag=11
America we know our history — it is perpetual testimony to impatient, demanding, unrelenting people who in every generation stand up for justice. #Cory2020
Our campaign is born out of a love for country. Together we can create an economy where one job is enough, health care is affordable for all, and teachers receive the respect they deserve.

The environment. LGBTQ+ rights. Health care. Education. We’re going to tackle these issues head on—and it all starts at #WinWithWarren organizing house parties like this one. RSVP to participate in a party near you: https://elizabethwarren.com/parties http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D4DQe2SWAAEPq5I.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1117121514145492992/vid/320x568/v_AIsmVyzRXgDFuu.mp4?tag=11
We can’t afford a politics of division that sacrifices progress for purity. Our first priority must be to make people’s lives better. Now. #Cory2020
Veterans deserve everything they have fought so bravely for— health care, education and good-paying jobs. #Cory2020
My heart is full. Thank you, Newark. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D4DrqtJWAAQsAnc.jpg
We can’t have social justice or economic justice if we don’t have environmental justice. #Cory2020 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D4DS90tW4AMbGwE.jpg

Three Black churches were burned down in Louisiana this month — another victim of the ugliness of hate and destruction. 

Our churches and places of worship should be safe for everyone, regardless of race or religion. We cannot let hate win.

I love hearing about what gets people in this fight. Whether it’s the student loan debt crisis, the environment, fair housing—we’re fighting for our futures and our kids' futures. https://twitter.com/eleanortwood/status/1116838224926773248 QT @eleanortwood Portsmouth is showing up tonight for @ewarren & sharing “why I’m in this fight” ✍🏼 my future ✍🏼 student loans ✍🏼 and on and on #NHPolitics #DreamBigFightHard http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D3_OZuGWkAAn1Gy.jpg

RT @RepEliotEngel Today as we intro the #DayOfSilence Res. we not only stand w/#LGBTQ students to call attention to the widespread harassment they face in school, we also stand with our brave #transgender servicemembers who proudly serve our country. 

You are not alone in this fight. #FightTheBan

Two years ago, Bodega owners across NYC (& cheered by neighbors)shut their shops citywide to protest Trump’s #MuslimBan.

Today, that same community is banding together to reject sales of the NY Post at bodegas citywide.

This is what real unity (& NYC solidarity) looks like ⬇️ https://twitter.com/debbialmontaser/status/1116883424659296258 QT @DebbiAlmontaser Yemeni Americans held a 1,000 bodega strike against the #MuslimBan, tonight we just declared a boycott of the racist NY Post! Starting tomorrow morning Yemeni American merchants will be rejecting the sale of the NY Post! NY Post take your papers back! #BoycottNYPost http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D3_3jHZWwAEbIUz.jpg

Turn back and live!

Ezekiel 18:31-32

Ms. Jones had reason to fall into the seduction of despair—her son was fatally shot in our lobby—but she didn't. She taught me that Newark didn’t need saving from our perceived destruction. It was the rest of the nation that needed help to see the goodness of this community.

I’m honored to play a small part in this city’s history. It’s my daily reminder that the lines that divide us are nowhere near as strong as the ties that bind us. We can’t wait:

—when this administration is throwing children into cages
—when brave transgender Americans are prevented from serving the country they love
—when people who work two or three jobs still can’t pay the bills

We can’t wait.

Together, we will run at the tough challenges.
Together, we will do the things that other people say are impossible.
Together, we will fulfill our pledge to be a nation of liberty and justice for all.
Together, we will win.
And together, we will rise. #Cory2020 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D4DVp0dXkAAevLn.jpg

When I moved here 20+ years ago, this city quickly humbled me. I met a woman named Virginia Jones, the tenant president in the projects where I lived & learned to see the promise of Newark amidst the very real pain.

“The world you see outside of you is a reflection of what you have inside of you,” she would say. If you only see darkness, that’s how you’re going to see cities, like Newark, that have faced economic insecurity, gun violence, corruption, failing education...

This is horrifying. Denying life-saving health care to those incarcerated is a violation of their basic human rights. 
https://preview.ajc.com/news/state--regional-govt--politics/for-some-prisons-and-jails-diabetes-has-meant-death-sentence/wVz7xy1g4ujG3ClhH1visJ/

And with this in mind, I was able to become a part of the community of activists already urgently working to change their circumstances and transform our city. And together, we achieved a lot.
Generations of Americans have shown us what was possible when they refused to wait for progress. Now it’s our turn. And we have work to do. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D4FAxNfXoAADCF9.jpg
Newark entered its largest period of economic growth since the 1960s. We built grocery stores in food deserts and businesses downtown. We made ambitious changes to city schools and created parks.
